title: Executive Order 8827-Exemption of Harry T. Edwards From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that Harry T. Edwards, senior technologist, Bureau of Plant Industry, Department of Agriculture, who was exempted from compulsory retirement for age for periods totaling two years by Executive Orders No. 8259 of September 21, 1939, and No. 8525 of August 26, 1940, be further exempted from such compulsory retirement for a period of one year:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), I hereby further exempt the said Harry T. Edwards from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending October 31, 1941.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8827-Exemption of Harry T. Edwards From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/371668
